1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS
What year did you start housekeeping in Eastern Canada? Fall of 1910
Where did you set up housekeeping? 8 Miles N.W. of Warman Sask.
Where had you been living before that? In North Dakota U.S.A.
For how many people did you prepare meals? 3-4 Batching
How far was it to your nearest store? 8 Miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? 10 Days
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Flour, Grits, Rolled oats, Cornmeal, Rolled wheat, Salt, Sugar, Coffee, Tea, Cocoa, Rice, Sago, Baking Powder

Soda

Milked a couple of cows.

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early years? Beef Rabbits
Grouse Ducks Crane's
How did you get fresh meat? Purchased to begin with
Later raised on the farm
How often did you get fresh meat? Mostly during Hunting Season
How did you preserve meat? No
Was there a "beef ring" in your neighborhood? No
If so what year was it organized?
Did you use game? Yes
What kinds? Grouse, Ducks, Crane, Moose, Deer
For how long? During Hunting Season's
That part did fish play in the family diet? Fished in the South Saskatchewan for Gold Eyes
Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned? Fresh & Smoked
Kinds? Gold Eye, Wall-eyed Pike Sometimes
We would buy fish from men returning from the North where they had been fishing during winter months many of them Homesteaders like ourselves.

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

December 1910 Breakfast

Porridge Toast Stued Prunes

Coffee. Dinner

"Boiya" baked by putting Potatoes Meat onions Salt & Pepper small amount of water & baked in hot oven one hour.

Supper

Three of us Bays had homesteaded close together so we Batched. We had Oyster Soup & Rabbit with other trimmings that I don't remember now. For Xmas Dinner that Year

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in your house? Give the menu. List each person and give their approximate ages at that time.

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

Yes in the winter of 1910 during January we never got to town for 4 weeks. We had Stormey Wether all this time. Three of us lived on Rolled Oats Porridge Syrup & Smoked Herring. Our cow dried up about Xmas on account of poor feed.
December/1910 Breakfast

Porridge Toast Stued Prunes

Coffee.

Dinner.

"Boiya" baked by putting Potatoes Meat Onions Salt & Pepper Small amount of Water & baked in hot oven one hour.

Substitutes for Porridge:

Milk

Bread

Include items not mentioned above, quality, methods of merchandising, prices, problems of storage, shortages and other details. (Use back of page if more space is needed).

Coming from the States we noticed quite a bit of difference in the price of groceries in Western Canada also. Different Brand's names appeared rather strange to us. It took a long time to get used to new Brand's names etc.
